Articles.Content:
Ever had a "I know all that already" feeling when watching regular science shows? Want a bit more "substance" or more detailed space/science information?

Have a look at ASTROBITES. Great summaries of scientific articles and papers. Some of the math stuff looks daunting, but they do a great job at explaining things.

Don't like to read? Well...first of all...what's wrong with you??? Secondly, check out Astronomycast

Lastly, I can recommend Centauri Dreams...especially if you are interested in interstellar travel.

YES, Thank you!

I'm always looking for more of this.

If you want to learn some things about advanced black holes and quantum mechanics, check out Leonard Susskind's lectures.
Here's Dr Bruce Betts' Online College introductory astronomy class archived at the Planetary Society: http://www.planetary.org/multimedia/video/bettsclass/ (I haven't watched it yet.)
